definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
presidential award (received by university students in Taiwan for academic excellence)

sentences.english: Thin film the scroll, clear bright light suspension.
sentences.chinese: 疏影臨書卷，清光皓月懸。

sentences.english: As the most important painting is of pedantic, but the foundation is still the most important thing.
sentences.chinese: 作畫自然是書卷氣爲重，但是根基還是最要緊的。

sentences.english: So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
sentences.chinese: 尼利亞的兒子巴錄就把書卷親自帶到他們那裏。

sentences.english: But on the way back, he’s reading from the Isaiah scroll.
sentences.chinese: 然而在他回家的路上，他在讀《以賽亞書》書卷。

sentences.english: In you whoe'er you are my book perusing.
sentences.chinese: 無論你是誰我都細刻入書卷。

sentences.english: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.
sentences.chinese: 因爲沒有配展開，配觀看那書卷的，我就大哭。

sentences.english: And they just had scrolls all in it.
sentences.chinese: 他們把書卷都放在裏面。

sentences.english: that the scholarliness can be first be gained by social learning.
sentences.chinese: 我一向以爲“書卷氣”首先是可以“學而知之”的。

sentences.english: What are your comments about King Jehoiakim's burning of the prophecy roll?
sentences.chinese: 你對約亞敬王焚燒預言書卷有何看法？

sentences.english: So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
sentences.chinese: 尼利亞的兒子巴錄就手拿書卷來到他們那裏。

sentences.english: In the other word, it can be shown on people’s face.
sentences.chinese: 換言之“書卷氣”是寫在每個人臉上的。

sentences.english: The unsealing of the little book was the message in relation to time.
sentences.chinese: 小書卷的開啓是與時間有關的信息。

sentences.english: She seeps her grief to them in the air of scholarly refinementbetween the lines.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己對他們的悲憫滲透在書卷氣的字裏行間。

definition: a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
